file_summary: This XML file represents a JMeter Test Plan designed for performance testing a 'PetClinic' web application. It simulates a load of 500 concurrent users, ramping up over 10 seconds, with each user performing 10 iterations of a predefined set of actions. The test plan includes user-defined variables for configuring the target application's host and port. It defines a series of HTTP requests covering common user flows such as accessing the home page, loading static resources (CSS, JS), viewing veterinarians, finding owners (including searching with an empty last name), viewing and editing existing owner details, and adding new pets and visits. The plan also incorporates a constant timer for pacing requests and counters to generate dynamic owner and pet IDs for specific test scenarios. It includes setup for HTTP defaults and cookie management, and configured listeners for viewing and aggregating test results.

attributes.name: PETCLINIC_HOST
attributes.description: The hostname of the PetClinic application (default: localhost).

attributes.name: PETCLINIC_PORT
attributes.description: The port number of the PetClinic application (default: 8080).

attributes.name: CONTEXT_WEB
attributes.description: The web context path for the application (default: empty string).

attributes.name: ThreadGroup.num_threads
attributes.description: Number of concurrent users for the load test (default: 500).

attributes.name: ThreadGroup.ramp_time
attributes.description: Time in seconds to ramp up all users (default: 10).

attributes.name: LoopController.loops
attributes.description: Number of iterations each user will perform (default: 10).

attributes.name: ConstantTimer.delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay in milliseconds between requests (default: 300).

attributes.name: count
attributes.description: An incremental counter used for owner IDs (starts at 1, ends at 3, increments by 1).

attributes.name: petCount
attributes.description: An incremental counter used for pet IDs (starts at 1, ends at 3, increments by 1).
